author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...ERIN BECOMES POST-TROPICAL, THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS THROUGH THE WEEKEND...
summary: ...ERIN BECOMES POST-TROPICAL, THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... As of 5:00 PM AST Fri Aug 22 the center of Erin was located near 40.0, -59.7 with movement ENE at 33 mph. The minimum central pressure was 957 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 90 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...ERIN BECOMES POST-TROPICAL, THIS IS THE LAST ADVISORY... ...SWIMMING AT MANY U.S. EAST COAST BEACHES IS LIKELY TO REMAIN DANGEROUS THROUGH THE WEEKEND... As of 5:00 PM AST Fri Aug 22 the center of Erin was located near 40.0, -59.7 with movement ENE at 33 mph. The minimum central pressure was 957 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 90 mph.

title: Summary - Post-Tropical Cyclone Erin (AT5/AL052025)
